meta.description: Retinal Disease Lexicon for ERG Digital Twin — structured knowledge base mapping diseases to affected cell types, ERG signatures, model parameter changes, and available treatments.

vasculature.label: Retinal Vasculature
vasculature.note: Not directly modeled in current ODE system; affects cell types indirectly via ischemia

a_wave.label: a-wave
a_wave.description: Initial negative deflection reflecting photoreceptor hyperpolarization

b_wave.label: b-wave
b_wave.description: Positive deflection driven by ON-bipolar depolarization and Müller cell currents

ops.label: Oscillatory Potentials
ops.description: High-frequency wavelets on b-wave ascending limb from amacrine reciprocal inhibition

d_wave.label: d-wave
d_wave.description: OFF-response at light offset, prominent in photopic conditions

p3.label: P3 (slow PIII)
p3.description: Slow negative component from Müller cell K+ buffering

c_wave.label: c-wave
c_wave.description: Slow positive component from RPE response to subretinal K+ decrease

phnr.label: PhNR
phnr.description: Photopic negative response reflecting retinal ganglion cell function

scotopic_threshold.label: Scotopic Threshold Response
scotopic_threshold.description: Near-threshold scotopic response from proximal retina

cell_effects.mechanism: Outer segment shortening → photoreceptor apoptosis, centripetal from periphery to center
Loss of rod-derived cone viability factor (RdCVF), oxidative stress from excess O2 in thinned outer retina
GFAP upregulation, hypertrophy, formation of glial seal, altered K+ buffering
Loss of presynaptic input from photoreceptors triggers inner retinal remodeling
Pigment migration into neural retina (bone spicule pattern), RPE atrophy

b_wave.note: b-wave implicit time delay is hallmark of progressive RP vs. CSNB

ops.note: Lost before a-wave and b-wave become unrecordable

flicker_30hz.note: 30Hz flicker delay is sensitive marker; used for monitoring progression

erg_signature.diagnostic_pattern: Scotopic responses reduced/absent with delayed implicit times before photopic changes. Progressive amplitude reduction correlates with photoreceptor loss area on OCT.

model_parameter_changes.note: Outer segment shortening reduces CNG channels
Inner retinal remodeling reduces ON-pathway contribution

staging.clinical: Night blindness, mid-peripheral visual field loss, minimal fundus changes
staging.erg: Scotopic b-wave reduced and delayed; photopic near-normal; OPs absent
staging.oct: Peripheral EZ band disruption; central structure preserved
staging.model_state: N_rod ~0.5-0.7, g_CNG_rod ~0.6x, all other params near normal

staging.clinical: Ring scotoma, bone spicule pigment, attenuated vessels, waxy disc pallor
staging.erg: Scotopic responses severely reduced or absent; photopic reduced and delayed
staging.oct: EZ band loss extending toward macula; CME may be present
staging.model_state: N_rod ~0.1-0.3, N_cone ~0.5-0.7, g_Kir reduced, ON-pathway params shifting

staging.clinical: Tunnel vision, severe nyctalopia, macular involvement
staging.oct: Widespread EZ loss, foveal thinning, epiretinal membrane
staging.model_state: N_rod ~0, N_cone ~0.1-0.3, significant inner retinal remodeling

treatments.name: Voretigene neparvovec (Luxturna)
treatments.mechanism: AAV2-delivered RPE65 gene replacement restores visual cycle in RPE cells
treatments.erg_effect: Improved FST (full-field sensitivity threshold); limited ERG amplitude recovery

treatments.name: RPGR gene therapy (multiple trials)
treatments.mechanism: AAV-delivered RPGR for X-linked RP
treatments.erg_effect: Stabilization of retinal sensitivity; microperimetry improvement

treatments.name: OCU400 (NR2E3 modifier therapy)
treatments.mechanism: Modified NR2E3 modulates retinal homeostasis across multiple RP genotypes

treatments.name: Vitamin A palmitate supplementation
treatments.mechanism: Slows ERG amplitude decline (~20% slower per year)

treatments.name: Optogenetic therapy
treatments.mechanism: Light-sensitive proteins expressed in surviving inner retinal neurons bypass photoreceptors
treatments.erg_effect: Does not restore conventional ERG; creates novel light responses

diseases.name: Congenital Stationary Night Blindness — Complete (Type 1, Schubert-Bornschein)

cell_effects.mechanism: Disrupted ON-bipolar signal transduction (mGluR6/TRPM1 cascade defective); photoreceptors structurally normal

flicker_30hz.note: Normal implicit time distinguishes from RP

erg_signature.diagnostic_pattern: ELECTRONEGATIVE ERG: preserved a-wave with severely attenuated b-wave. This is the cardinal sign. Normal implicit times distinguish CSNB from progressive RP.

model_parameter_changes.note: TRPM1 channel completely non-functional in complete CSNB
ON pathway contributes nothing; b-wave absent

staging.clinical: Night blindness from birth, reduced visual acuity, myopia, nystagmus possible
staging.erg: Electronegative ERG: normal a-wave, absent/severely reduced b-wave

treatments.name: Gene therapy for CSNB (preclinical)
treatments.mechanism: Restore ON-bipolar signaling; demonstrated in mouse models

key_references: Zeitz et al. Prog Retin Eye Res 2015

cell_effects.mechanism: Defective Ca2+ channel at photoreceptor synapse; phototransduction intact but synaptic release impaired
Same Ca2+ channel defect affects cone synaptic transmission

b_wave.note: Electronegative but less severe than complete CSNB; residual b-wave present

erg_signature.diagnostic_pattern: Electronegative ERG with residual b-wave and characteristic broadened/bifurcated 30Hz flicker trough. Less severe than complete CSNB.

model_parameter_changes.note: Reduced but not absent ON-pathway drive

diseases.name: Leber Congenital Amaurosis

cell_effects.mechanism: Gene-dependent: RPE65 → visual cycle block; GUCY2D → cGMP synthesis failure; AIPL1 → PDE instability; CRB1 → photoreceptor structural defect
Most LCA subtypes affect both rod and cone pathways from birth
RPE65-LCA: visual cycle enzyme absent in RPE; all-trans retinal cannot be recycled

erg_signature.diagnostic_pattern: Severely abnormal or extinguished ERG from birth/early infancy. This is the defining electrophysiological feature. Some genotypes (e.g., CEP290) may have residual cone-mediated responses.

model_parameter_changes.note: For RPE65: quantum efficiency effectively zero without 11-cis retinal

treatments.name: Voretigene neparvovec (Luxturna)
treatments.mechanism: AAV2-delivered RPE65 restores visual cycle; subretinal injection
treatments.erg_effect: Improved light sensitivity (FST); variable ERG amplitude recovery; pupillometry improvement

treatments.name: EDIT-101 (CEP290 gene editing)
treatments.mechanism: CRISPR/Cas9 to remove intronic splice mutation IVS26 in CEP290

treatments.name: OPGx-LCA5 (Opus Genetics)
treatments.mechanism: AAV8-delivered LCA5 gene to outer retina

treatments.name: AIPL1 gene therapy
treatments.mechanism: AAV-delivered AIPL1; first-in-human 2025 (Michaelides et al. Lancet 2025)

key_references: den Hollander et al. Prog Retin Eye Res 2008
Kumaran et al. Br J Ophthalmol 2017

cell_effects.mechanism: ABCA4 dysfunction → A2E (bisretinoid) accumulates in RPE → phototoxicity → RPE cell death
RPE death leads to photoreceptor loss; preferentially macular cones
Peripheral rods affected in advanced disease (Lois Group 3)

pattern_erg.note: PERG is the most sensitive ERG measure; reduced P50 indicates macular dysfunction

multifocal_erg.note: mfERG shows central depression corresponding to macular lesion

erg_signature.diagnostic_pattern: Full-field ERG may be NORMAL early (Lois Group 1: macular dysfunction only). PERG and mfERG show macular deficit. Groups 2/3 show generalized cone or rod-cone dysfunction on ffERG. EOG is abnormal (suppressed Arden ratio).

lois_groups.group_1: Macular dysfunction only; normal ffERG, abnormal PERG/mfERG
lois_groups.group_2: Generalized cone dysfunction + macular; reduced photopic ffERG
lois_groups.group_3: Generalized cone AND rod dysfunction; reduced scotopic and photopic ffERG

treatments.name: SB-007 (dual-vector ABCA4)
treatments.mechanism: Dual AAV8 split-intein vectors reconstitute full-length ABCA4 (gene too large for single AAV)

treatments.name: Complement factor inhibition
treatments.mechanism: Reduce complement-mediated RPE/photoreceptor damage

treatments.name: Visual cycle modulators (emixustat, ALK-001)
treatments.mechanism: Slow A2E accumulation by reducing visual cycle flux

diseases.name: Best Vitelliform Macular Dystrophy

cell_effects.mechanism: BEST1 (bestrophin-1) encodes a Ca-activated Cl channel in RPE; dysfunction leads to abnormal fluid/ion transport and lipofuscin accumulation between RPE and photoreceptors
Subretinal vitelliform material disrupts photoreceptor-RPE interface

eog.note: EOG is the KEY diagnostic test. Abnormal EOG with normal ffERG is pathognomonic for Best disease.

erg_signature.diagnostic_pattern: NORMAL full-field ERG with ABNORMAL EOG (Arden ratio < 1.5). This combination is virtually diagnostic. Pattern ERG may be reduced if macular lesion is large.

model_parameter_changes.note: Bestrophin-1 is a Cl channel, not directly in current K-based RPE model; would need Cl conductance addition
c-wave depends on RPE function; reduced in Best

key_references: Boon et al. Prog Retin Eye Res 2009

diseases.name: X-Linked Juvenile Retinoschisis

cell_effects.mechanism: Retinoschisin (RS1) is a cell adhesion protein; its absence causes splitting at inner nuclear layer, disrupting bipolar cell signaling
Schisis cavities disrupt Müller cell processes spanning retinal layers

erg_signature.diagnostic_pattern: ELECTRONEGATIVE ERG similar to complete CSNB. Key differential: XLRS has foveal schisis on OCT, spoke-wheel macular pattern. Inner retinal splitting at INL level.

model_parameter_changes.note: Disrupted bipolar cell signal transmission through schisis

treatments.name: RS1 gene therapy (multiple trials)
treatments.mechanism: Intravitreal AAV-delivered RS1; aim to restore cell adhesion and close schisis cavities

key_references: Sauer et al. Prog Retin Eye Res 2012

cell_effects.mechanism: Hyperglycemia → pericyte loss → capillary basement membrane thickening → microaneurysms → capillary non-perfusion → neovascularization
Inner retinal neurons affected BEFORE visible vascular lesions; dopaminergic and GABAergic amacrine cells particularly vulnerable to metabolic stress
GABAergic amacrines affected by glutamate excitotoxicity and oxidative stress
RGC loss documented even before clinically evident DR; inner retinal thinning on OCT
Müller cells become reactive; GFAP upregulation; altered glutamate transport; contribute to BRB breakdown via VEGF release
Dark adaptation impaired in diabetics even without visible DR; rod sensitivity reduced

a_wave.note: a-wave reduction documented in T1D without DR

ops.note: OP amplitude reduction and implicit time delay are the MOST SENSITIVE ERG indicators of DR, detectable BEFORE clinical retinopathy

erg_signature.diagnostic_pattern: OPs are the most sensitive indicator — reduced amplitude and delayed implicit time PRECEDE visible vascular lesions. OP changes predict progression to proliferative DR. Rod-derived responses affected before cone responses. PhNR reduction reflects early RGC involvement.

staging.clinical: No visible fundus changes; diabetes diagnosed
staging.erg: OPs reduced and delayed; subtle rod a-wave changes; PhNR may be reduced
staging.model_state: Amacrine params mildly shifted; photoreceptor params near normal

staging.erg: OPs further reduced; rod and cone b-wave reduction beginning

staging.clinical: Hemorrhages, hard exudates, cotton wool spots, venous beading
staging.erg: All scotopic components reduced; 30Hz flicker delayed
staging.model_state: Broad parameter shifts across inner retina

staging.erg: Severely reduced responses; may be unrecordable if media opacity

treatments.name: Anti-VEGF injection (ranibizumab, aflibercept, faricimab)
treatments.mechanism: Reduce VEGF-driven neovascularization and macular edema

treatments.name: Pan-retinal photocoagulation (PRP)
treatments.mechanism: Destroy ischemic retina to reduce VEGF drive

treatments.name: Glycemic control
treatments.mechanism: HbA1c reduction slows progression (DCCT/UKPDS)

diseases.name: Central Retinal Vein Occlusion

cell_effects.mechanism: Thrombosis at lamina cribrosa → raised venous pressure → hemorrhage → ischemia
Inner retinal ischemia from capillary non-perfusion

a_wave.note: Depends on ischemia severity; photoreceptors relatively spared (choroidal supply)

erg_signature.diagnostic_pattern: b:a ratio on bright flash scotopic ERG predicts ischemic vs. non-ischemic CRVO. b:a < 1 (electronegative) → ischemic, high risk of neovascularization. OPs reduced proportional to ischemia.

key_references: Matsui et al. Jpn J Ophthalmol 1994

cell_effects.mechanism: Drusen (lipid/protein deposits) form between RPE and Bruch's membrane → complement activation → RPE degeneration → geographic atrophy
RPE atrophy leads to photoreceptor loss in areas of geographic atrophy; preferentially macular
Rod function in macula impaired even before drusen visible; dark adaptation delay is earliest functional sign of AMD

a_wave.note: ffERG may be normal because macular area is small relative to total retina

pattern_erg.note: Most sensitive ERG measure for macular dysfunction in AMD

multifocal_erg.note: mfERG implicit time delays in early AMD predict progression to advanced disease

erg_signature.diagnostic_pattern: Full-field ERG is often NORMAL in early-moderate AMD (macular lesion too small). PERG and mfERG are key: mfERG implicit time delays in perilesional zones predict GA expansion. Dark adaptation testing (non-ERG) is the earliest functional biomarker.

treatments.name: Pegcetacoplan (Syfovre)
treatments.mechanism: Complement C3 inhibitor; slows geographic atrophy growth by ~20%

treatments.name: Avacincaptad pegol (Izervay)
treatments.mechanism: Complement C5 inhibitor; slows GA growth

treatments.name: AREDS2 supplementation
treatments.mechanism: Antioxidant vitamins + lutein/zeaxanthin reduce risk of progression to advanced AMD

cell_effects.mechanism: NR2E3 mutation → photoreceptor precursors fail to differentiate into rods; instead become S-cone-like cells
Excess S-cones replace rods; L/M cones may be reduced

b_wave.note: PATHOGNOMONIC: delayed, increased b-wave amplitude at low scotopic intensities due to S-cone hypersensitivity

s_cone_erg.note: S-cone ERG is massively supranormal — pathognomonic

erg_signature.diagnostic_pattern: PATHOGNOMONIC: Supranormal S-cone ERG response with absent rod response and delayed/enhanced scotopic waveform. One of the few diseases diagnosed solely on ERG pattern.

model_parameter_changes.note: Would need cone subtype model (S vs L/M) not in current spec

diseases.name: Achromatopsia (Rod Monochromacy)

cell_effects.mechanism: Cone phototransduction cascade non-functional; gene-dependent (CNG channel or transducin/PDE defects)

erg_signature.diagnostic_pattern: Normal scotopic ERG with ABSENT photopic and 30Hz flicker responses. This pattern is diagnostic. Distinguishes from incomplete achromatopsia (reduced but present cone responses) and blue cone monochromatism (S-cone signal detectable with blue-on-yellow).

model_parameter_changes.note: For GNAT2/PDE6C: cone transduction cascade broken

treatments.name: CNGA3 gene therapy
treatments.mechanism: AAV-delivered CNGA3 to restore cone CNG channel function

treatments.name: CNGB3 gene therapy
treatments.mechanism: AAV-delivered CNGB3

key_references: Kohl et al. Hum Mol Genet 1998

cell_effects.mechanism: Premature retina is avascular peripherally; hyperoxia → VEGF suppression → vascular growth arrest; then relative hypoxia → VEGF surge → abnormal neovascularization
Rod photoreceptor maturation delayed in premature infants; may have long-term subtle deficits
Vascular insufficiency affects inner retinal development

a_wave.note: Even in premature infants without ROP, rod ERG is immature

ops.note: OPs are particularly reduced in ROP; may predict severity

erg_signature.diagnostic_pattern: ERG shows maturational delay compared to term infants. In treated/regressed ROP, long-term ERG deficits persist: reduced scotopic responses, reduced OPs, suggesting lasting inner retinal dysfunction. Severity of ERG changes correlates with ROP stage.

treatments.name: Anti-VEGF injection (ranibizumab)
treatments.mechanism: Reduce pathologic neovascularization

treatments.name: Laser photocoagulation
treatments.mechanism: Ablate avascular peripheral retina

treatments.name: Careful oxygen management
treatments.mechanism: Titrate supplemental O2 to minimize hyperoxia-hypoxia swings

differential_diagnosis_rules.description: Normal a-wave with severely reduced b-wave (b:a ratio < 1)

differential.distinguishing: Males, foveal schisis on OCT, spoke-wheel macula

differential_diagnosis_rules.description: No recordable scotopic or photopic responses

differential.distinguishing: Advanced stage, bone spicules, progressive history
Acute/subacute onset in adult, anti-recoverin antibodies

differential_diagnosis_rules.description: OPs reduced or delayed with relatively preserved a-wave and b-wave

differential.distinguishing: Diabetes history, may precede visible lesions

differential_diagnosis_rules.description: Full-field ERG normal but EOG Arden ratio reduced

differential.distinguishing: Flecks, dark choroid on FA, ABCA4 mutation (some variants)

differential_diagnosis_rules.description: Enhanced/delayed scotopic b-wave with absent or supranormal S-cone response
